result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert MLB Buehner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Sentence credit of 6 days were granted if revoked.

miscConds.notes: Cash bail applied to costs. Balance to be paid as a condition of probation.
Defendant to engage in Domestic Abuse Counseling. Follow through with any treatment or counseling recommended by agent.
Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.

No Violent contact with the victim listed in the criminal complaint.
  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

Affidavit of Services Rendered, Billing Statement and Cover Letter, filed by Atty. Babe.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Robert MLB Buehner in court with attorney Katie Elizabeth Babe.  Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 2.  Court finds defendant guilty.  Count 1 is dismissed and read-in.  The Defendant was sentenced to the following:

COUNT 2

SENTENCE WITHHELD

TERM OF PROBATION:  12 MONTHS; 6-days credit, if revoked

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  

*Engage in Domestic Abuse Counseling ;
*Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
*No violent contact with victim listed in the Complaint

COURT COSTS:  $343.00 includes domestic abuse surcharge (apply cash bail and balance to be paid as a condition of probation)
DNA SURCHARGE:  $200.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation);
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department

Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new law violations.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 3, 2017 at 10:00 am.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Michael L Buehner in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Barry Braatz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant requests a court appointed attorney.  Court reviews petition and grants Defendant's request.  Defendant to pay for such counsel at rate of $50.00 per month, commencing 2/1/17 (in conjunction with Case #16CM2102).  Court adjourns.   Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for February 17, 2017 at 10:30 am.
Defendant is not to have any violent contact with any witness listed in the Criminal complaint.

Defendant allowed 2 non-collect calls to obtain bail.
